We have four young children so finding work that pays enough to suuport us all is not an easy task. In our most recent conversation regarding this topic we both felt the urge to move back, yet it was somewhat stronger than usual because we were feeling particularly isolated at the time. I had just undergone surgery to remove a kidney stone just before that our youngest child, who is an infant, fell out of a chair he had climbed into and bumped his head on the tile floor. We panicked and took him to the ER. He was fine, however, that trip lightened our bank account by over $2K. I guess you can put a price on peace of mind. message: My partner and I were at a bird show a few months ago. We enjoyed seeing all the birds and we chatted about them. Flash forward to several days later. My partner surprises me at the door. He has purchased an exotic bird for me as a pet! This is very coincidental, because the very night before, I was having a vivid dream about exotic birds, perhaps as a result of attending the bird show.
recall: During the conversation at the bird show, I felt interested in the birds, but I did not pay great attention to our chat. Mostly I was focused on the birds. But I could tell my partner was listening to everything I was saying and taking mental notes.

message: My boyfriend and I were discussing the idea that life ultimately has no meaning.  We were talking about Thomas Ligotti, who believes that life is meaningless and full of suffering, and does not think that people should reproduce because it would pass suffering on to others.  My boyfriend and I were talking about how life is not full of suffering, but is made up of both bad and good experiences.  We agreed that life may ultimately have no meaning, but it falls to the individual to give it meaning and find a purpose.
recall: I felt very connected to my boyfriend, like he and I were on the same level of deep understanding at a fundamental and very human level.

message: We were discussing the future together were we were financially independent and free. We would be living comfortable traveling as much as we would want to. This required hard work at first but in the end, it would all be worth it.
recall: I felt empowered and motivated. I was happy and felt as if it was all achievable which I know it is.

message: We were discussing parenting strategies for when our son got older.
recall: Fine. We agreed about a lot of things.

message: We always seem to be in sync when watching a crime related tv show, we are almost always able to be in sync with the outcome or who done it.
recall: I feel like I have found my perfect match and that I would love to be that in sync in other times of our life.

message: We were talking about opening our own car body shop.  We were so into the planning of it that we seemed to be thinking the same thing at the same time.   Every time one of us was thinking of something we could do to accomplish opening it,  The other would verbally say it.  It was like we were reading each others minds.  I love when we do things like this.
recall: I felt happy and very loved.  He really  seem to care about what I had to offer.

message: We were discussing the possibility of his taking a new job in New York if he was offered it. He was really excited about the idea and even started looking up places to live etc. At first I wasn't too upset by the idea of moving again, but as I started to really consider the implications and all that we would have to give up all over again, I got more and more upset. He made it seem like if he got offered the job, he would take it no matter what, and I felt powerless.  /  / In the end he didn't get offered the job, anyway, so it was okay.
recall: I felt very small and like I had no say in what happens in our life. I felt afraid, and gradually grew panicked.

message: I can't think of any one thing specifically. It literally happens with almost everything we talk and think about. It has been that way for the last 13 years. My wife and I dated for a week and got married. We both have a wicked habit of finishing each other's sentences, knowing when one of us needs the other (even if we aren't in the same room or even house). I was fortunate enough to find my best friend and marry her.
recall: I feel connected to my wife in ways that go beyond explanation. Most of the time I feel like she is the only person who truly "gets" me. I feel like I am one person in two different bodies when we talk.

message: We were discussing whether or not to purchase a car. We have been saving very diligently over the past year and have accumulated a good nest egg, for us anyway. We share a car, and it's kind of been on the fritz lately. We decided that we do need another car, and my husband found one we were interested in. When we went to the dealership, the price was way too high for me. We completely disagreed about the purchase, and argued quite a bit. Eventually, we were able to get the dealer to drop the price quite a bit, and we did end up buying the car.
recall: I felt very frustrated. I was so nervous that we would end up buying the car and draining our savings. I was afraid that we wouldn't be able to compromise.
